result.execSummary:
The defendant Kip A Kuehn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 58 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kip A Kuehn

Defendant Kip A Kuehn in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Defendant graduated from Drug Treatment Court.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  6 MONTHS

___ DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)

COSTS:  WAIVED

DNA SURCHARGE: WAIVED

NOTE:  Defendant has 58 days credit, if ever revoked.

Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kip A Kuehn in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Smith.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 with repeater enhancer stricken.   Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.
